links.title: The revenue-growth rate that helped fuel Tesla's rally relied on an apples-to-oranges comparison
links.description: By A previous version of this story misstated Tesla's reported automotive sales revenue in the second quarters of 2017 and 2018. The accurate figures are $2.287 billion and $3.358 billion for 2017 and 2018, respectively. The story has been corrected.

messages.body: $TSLA Ah give me a break already. 3 weeks ago it was all about parking lots full of cars. Go look up what FUD means.

links.title: Tesla's Phony Quarterly Numbers
links.description: Tesla reported its Q2 numbers this past Wednesday. It reported $4 billion in revenue, up 43.4% year over year. Its net loss widened to $742 million, or $4.22 per share (some of you may have seen lower net loss and loss per share numbers but the numbers I'm using come directly from the SEC-filed 8-K, which means those are the "official" numbers).

links.title: Musk Says Norwegians Are `Right to Be Upset' With Tesla Service
links.description: Elon Musk said Thursday that the frustrations of Tesla owners in one of its biggest markets are justified. "Norwegians are right to be upset with Tesla," the chief executive officer said in a tweet. "We are having trouble expanding our service facilities in Oslo especially.

links.title: Tesla is back on a 'hiring spree' following massive layoffs
links.description: After initiating a restructure of the company that resulted in laying off 9% of its workforce last quarter, Tesla is apparently back on a 'hiring spree' as it attempts to deliver a record number of vehicles this quarter and achieve profitability.

messages.body: $TSLA Nothing can touch a Tessie https://cleantechnica.com/2018/08/05/pure-jungle-cat-tesla-model-3-performance-review-from-motor-trend/

links.title: "Pure Jungle Cat" - Tesla Model 3 Performance Review From Motor Trend
links.description: It's one thing for Tesla to get a strong review of its performance Model 3 in the Wall Street Journal, but what about a car magazine? It turns out that the team at Motor Trend got a chance to test drive the much-anticipated dual motor, performance (DMP) version of Tesla's newer, smaller sedan.

links.title: Expected Market Maker Moves For The Big Stocks
links.description: The expected move that a stock makes is very important to know. The easiest way to get an idea of the move is to price a straddle at the close of trading on Friday. That is buying one call and one put at an ATM strike.
